p: Our results suggest the possibility of greater presence of FCB–and thus pathogenic bacteria—in output water, particularly if bacterial growth takes place under CC. Many pathogenic microorganisms require relatively small doses to cause illness in humans. For example, E. coli O157:H7, which produces shiga toxin and can cause kidney failure and death, requires fewer than 10 cells to cause illness [ 35], while an infected human will release 10 5−10 8 cells in feces [ 36].
